content:
• Thursday, May 17, 2012
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) is up 7.2% AH after the company follows up on its FQ1 beat and...

    Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM) is up 7.2% AH after the company follows up on its FQ1 beat and guidance hike with a largely positive earnings call. While guiding for flat Q/Q deferred revenue growth, Salesforce says its FQ2 pipeline is "unlike anything seen before in size, scope." CEO Mark Benioff also couldn't resist taking a shot at SAP, which recently bought rival cloud software vendor SuccessFactors.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM | 1 Comment

  • Sirius XM Radio CEO Mel Karmazin reports selling 13.7M shares of stock starting on May 15th....

    Sirius XM Radio CEO Mel Karmazin reports selling 13.7M shares of stock starting on May 15th. Shares -0.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE -13%), clobbered today on news of the U.S. government's imposition of...

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE -13%), clobbered today on news of the U.S. government's imposition of anti-dumping tariffs on Chinese solar firms, rises 2.9% AH after stating its tariff rate will be 31.2%, at the low end of a 31%-250% range. Yingli adds it will continue to "aggressively defend [itself]", and notes a final decision on the tariffs remains to be made by the Commerce department and ITC (it's due before the end of 2012).

     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • OSIR

    Osiris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OSIR) has received marketing approval from Health Canada to market...

    Osiris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OSIR) has received marketing approval from Health Canada to market its stem cell therapy Prochymal for the treatment of acute graft-vs-host disease in children. The approval marks the first time a manufactured stem cell product has been given regulatory clearance and the first therapy approved for the disease. Shares +14% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM
  • PFPT

    More on Proofpoint (NASDAQ:PFPT): reports a Q1 loss of $0.08 per share, missing consensus...

    More on Proofpoint (NASDAQ:PFPT): reports a Q1 loss of $0.08 per share, missing consensus estimates by $0.27. Revenues were $24.6M, beating expectations by $1M. For Q2, the company expects to report a loss in the range of $0.09 - $0.10 on revenues of $24M - $25M, compared to a Street view of a $0.12 loss per share on revenues of $24M. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • PSUN

    More on Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN): Q1 blows away estimates on fewer losses. Overall revenue...

    More on Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN): Q1 blows away estimates on fewer losses. Overall revenue was relatively flat, with same-store sales increasing only a paltry 1%, but gross margins jumped as the company posted strong sales late in the quarter. Shares +23% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan (NYSE:KMI) will replace El Paso (EP) in the S&P 500 index after the close on...

    Kinder Morgan (NYSE:KMI) will replace El Paso (EP) in the S&P 500 index after the close on May 24. KMI is acquiring EP in a deal expected to be completed near that date. KMI +3.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +4.1% AH after the FDA approves its Epic vascular stent designed to...

    Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +4.1% AH after the FDA approves its Epic vascular stent designed to open blocked arteries in patients with iliac artery stenosis, a form of peripheral vascular disease associated with severe leg pain caused by insufficient blood flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) says the recently announced provider network participation agreement with...

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) says the recently announced provider network participation agreement with Coventry Health Care (CVH) has been terminated without cause by Coventry. The agreement was intended to provide members in the network with coverage for Sequenom CMM's MaterniT21 PLUS laboratory-developed test. SQNM -7.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • YOKU

    Youku (NYSE:YOKU): Q1 EPS of -$0.22 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $42.9M (+119% Y/Y) beats by...

    Youku (NYSE:YOKU): Q1 EPS of -$0.22 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $42.9M (+119% Y/Y) beats by $1.7M. Shares +2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • MRVL

    More on Marvell's FQ1: The chipmaker is initiating a $0.06/share dividend (good for a yield of...

    More on Marvell's FQ1: The chipmaker is initiating a $0.06/share dividend (good for a yield of 1.8%), and expanding its stock buyback authorization by $500M to $848M. Marvell attributes its strong FQ1 performance to a 25% Q/Q increase in TD-SCDMA baseband chip sales for phones on China Mobile's network, and rising sales of notebook hard drive controller chips. $223M worth of shares were repurchased during the quarter. MRVL +3.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • ADSK

    More on Autodesk's FQ1: Though results weren't bad, the CAD software giant is guiding for FQ2...

    More on Autodesk's FQ1: Though results weren't bad, the CAD software giant is guiding for FQ2 revenue of $580M-$600M and EPS of $0.46-$0.51, largely below a consensus of $600.7M and $0.51. Also, guidance for FY13 revenue growth of 10% is slightly below a 10.4% consensus, and below a long-term target of 12%-14%. FQ1 deferred revenue rose 1% Q/Q and 17% Y/Y to $727M. Americas revenue +14% Y/Y, Asia +19%, EMEA +4%. ADSK -7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • CRM

    More on Salesforce.com's FQ1: Deferred revenue was $1.33B, down 4% Q/Q (affected by seasonality)...

    More on Salesforce.com's FQ1: Deferred revenue was $1.33B, down 4% Q/Q (affected by seasonality) but up 46% Y/Y. Unbilled deferred revenue +23% Q/Q to $2.7B. Free cash flow was $168.5M, up 50% Y/Y. Sales/marketing expenses continue to surge, +45% Y/Y to $369.8M (53% of revenue). R&D expenses +45% to $94.8M (14% of revenue). CRM now +6.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT): FQ2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $2.54B (-11.3% Y/Y)...

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT): FQ2 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $2.54B (-11.3% Y/Y) beats by $150M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q1 EPS of $0.13 in-line. Revenue of $497M (+6% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares...

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO): Q1 EPS of $0.13 in-line. Revenue of $497M (+6% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares -4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • GPS

    More on Gap's (NYSE:GPS) Q1: Comparable-store sales +4% Y/Y, led by Gap North America +5% and...

    More on Gap's (NYSE:GPS) Q1: Comparable-store sales +4% Y/Y, led by Gap North America +5% and Banana Republic +4%. International net sales +13% to $511M. Net 7 stores opened during quarter. Sees full-year EPS of $1.78-$1.83, up from prior guidance of $1.75-$1.80 - but lower than $1.98 consensus. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • MRVL

    Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q1 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $796M (-0.7% Y/Y)...

    Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL): Q1 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $796M (-0.7% Y/Y) beats by $29M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q1 EPS of $0.47 in-line. Revenue of $589M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $3M....

    Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK): Q1 EPS of $0.47 in-line. Revenue of $589M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q1 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $129.9M (+22.7% Y/Y) in-line....

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ): Q1 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $129.9M (+22.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • GTATQ

    Not participating in today's gains enjoyed by at least some solar players is GT Advanced...

    Not participating in today's gains enjoyed by at least some solar players is GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -16%), which turned in FQ4 results well below Street expectations as its photovoltaic equipment business suffered under a global slowdown in solar product demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 6 Comments
  • CHK

    The custodian of a group of NYC pension funds owning 1.9M shares of Chesapeake Energy (CHK...

    The custodian of a group of NYC pension funds owning 1.9M shares of Chesapeake Energy (CHK -3.8%) calls on shareholders to vote against two board members in upcoming elections, saying they failed to monitor Aubrey McClendon's financial activities that have engulfed the company in controversy.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 10 Comments
  • FSLR

    The U.S. government has imposed anti-dumping duties of 31%-250% on Chinese solar imports, a...

    The U.S. government has imposed anti-dumping duties of 31%-250% on Chinese solar imports, a source tells Bloomberg. The duties are the result of an investigation into whether Chinese firms, backed by government subsidies, have been selling modules below cost to drive out competition. First Solar (FSLR +7.2%) and SunPower (SPWR +13.6% - previous) are rallying on the news, while some (though not all) Chinese vendors are selling off: YGE -11.8%. HOKU -8.8%. LDK -3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARP

    Atlas Resource Partners (ARP +3.8%) agrees to buy privately-held Titan Operating for ~$184M in...

    Atlas Resource Partners (ARP +3.8%) agrees to buy privately-held Titan Operating for ~$184M in its second recent deal for assets in Texas' Barnett Shale. The acquisition will add ~250B cubic feet of natural gas equivalent of proved reserves to ARP's assets, pushing its total to 530B cfe.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • SPWR

    SunPower (SPWR +10.6%) spikes higher after Reuters reports Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) will use its...

    SunPower (SPWR +10.6%) spikes higher after Reuters reports Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) will use its solar modules to power its giant Maiden, NC data center, which opened last year. Apple's solar farm, which also uses renewable systems from startup Bloom Energy, will produce 84M kWh of energy annually.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • CHK

    Several large hedge funds and advisory firms sold large positions in Chesapeake (CHK -3.4%) in...

    Several large hedge funds and advisory firms sold large positions in Chesapeake (CHK -3.4%) in Q1, showing CHK was losing some its luster even before its odd financial arrangements became widely followed. SAC Capital sold 91% of its CHK holdings in the quarter, Millenium 86%, Fidelity 59% (but still held $164M at the end of Q1).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • NTES

    Chinese online game developer/portal NetEase (NTES +5.2%) makes new highs after reporting Q1...

    Chinese online game developer/portal NetEase (NTES +5.2%) makes new highs after reporting Q1 revenue of $318.2M (+39% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.14, beating Street estimates by $8.5M and $0.13. Growth was fueled by strong uptake for the company's Ghost and Tianxia III games. In addition, NetEase reported a 24% Q/Q increase for users of its microblogging service to 121M (SINA's Weibo has 300M+), and a 6.7% Q/Q increase in registered e-mail accounts to 480M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • EXPE

    Online travel stocks take a beating, with Expedia (EXPE -4.2%), Priceline.com (PCLN -1.9%,...

    Online travel stocks take a beating, with Expedia (EXPE -4.2%), Priceline.com (PCLN -1.9%, Orbitz Worldwide (OWW -8.7%), and Tripadvisor (TRIP -4.4%) all underperforming market indexes. Though shares of Ctrip.com (CTRP +8.1%) are downright giddy following a pair of analyst upgrades, the broader theme from the analyst coverage paints a picture of intense competition and shrinking margins in the sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • OLED

    KeyBanc defends Universal Display (PANL -10%) following its disclosing of negative Japanese...

    KeyBanc defends Universal Display (PANL -10%) following its disclosing of negative Japanese patent rulings. The firm claims the ruling will have "little to no impact" on PANL's financials, and notes Japanese patent law is stricter than U.S. law; the patents in question have also been issued in the U.S. However, KeyBanc does grant the ruling could affect PANL's ability to collect royalties on Japanese products - a small % of its business today, but one many expect to grow thanks to new deals. Update: Piper and JNK Securities weigh in on recent events.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • LF

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF -8.1%) trade weak as insider sales keep rolling in after the company...

    Shares of LeapFrog (LF -8.1%) trade weak as insider sales keep rolling in after the company released a strong earnings report and rosy guidance early this month.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • PLCE

    Children's Place (PLCE +6%) posted a mixed Q1 result, beating on a per share basis but missing...

    Children's Place (PLCE +6%) posted a mixed Q1 result, beating on a per share basis but missing slightly on revenue. Net earnings slumped 19% Y/Y despite a modest increase in sales as the retailer's bid to cut costs and reshape its operations hurt bottom line margins. The stock is trading higher today, however, as forward-looking investors react to the company raising the low end of its FY12 forecast.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • AAPL

    Is the Facebook IPO hurting Apple (AAPL -1.8%)? As shares fall further below the levels they...

    Is the Facebook IPO hurting Apple (AAPL -1.8%)? As shares fall further below the levels they traded at prior to Apple's strong FQ2 report, one theory making the rounds is that NASDAQ index funds are selling to make room for Facebook and its likely $100B+ market cap. In addition, Bloomberg reports a number of major hedge funds, including SAC Capital and Viking Global, took profits on Apple in Q1, though they collectively still held 37.8M shares at quarter's end.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 18 Comments
  • BKE

    Buckle (BKE +5.5%) jumps after beating Q1 estimates this morning. Net earnings rose 13% Y/Y...

    Buckle (BKE +5.5%) jumps after beating Q1 estimates this morning. Net earnings rose 13% Y/Y despite rising costs for labor and commodities, especially cotton, as better cost controls helped margins and same-store sales improved.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • HLF

    Up nearly 20% yesterday when David Einhorn didn't mention it at his Ira Sohn presentation (and...

    Up nearly 20% yesterday when David Einhorn didn't mention it at his Ira Sohn presentation (and even intimated it was an imposter on the infamous conference call), Herbalife (HLF -7.3%) slides anew. Nu Skin (NUS -10%) also gives back a big chunk of yesterday's gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • DANG

    E-Commerce China Dangdang (DANG -15.1%) plummets after delivering soft revenue guidance to go...

    E-Commerce China Dangdang (DANG -15.1%) plummets after delivering soft revenue guidance to go with mixed Q1 results. The online bookseller says it expects Q2 revenue of RMB1186M ($187.5M), below a consensus of $202.1M. Also, Dangdang's Q1 cost of sales amounted to 85.8% of revenue, up 530 bps Y/Y. A mix shift towards lower-margin general merchandise sales relative to media sales was responsible for the increase. Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) can probably sympathize. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF -8%) comes back down to earth today following yesterday's late session pop after...

    Herbalife (HLF -8%) comes back down to earth today following yesterday's late session pop after David Einhorn ignored the stock in his presentation at the Ira Sohn conference. Caris upgrades the shares to Buy on the pass, saying a significant near-term risk catalyst has been removed. The firm now expects the stock to trade on its own strong fundamentals.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -4.1%) is the Dow's biggest decliner after announcing slowing global sales...

    Caterpillar (CAT -4.1%) is the Dow's biggest decliner after announcing slowing global sales growth of construction and mining machinery in the three months ending in April. Asia/Pacific +5%; Europe, Africa and Middle East +14%; Latin America -13%; North America +32%; world +12%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • WMT

    Proxy advisory firm Egan Jones recommends that Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) shareholders vote against...

    Proxy advisory firm Egan Jones recommends that Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) shareholders vote against re-electing CEO Michael Duke and former CEO Lee Scott to the retailer's board, citing reports of their failure to properly investigate the bribery allegations in Mexico. While WMT today disclosed inquiries into the affair, shares are +5% following its earnings beat.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 3 Comments
  • NBY

    Microcap pharmaceutical developer NovaBay (NBY +11.7%) pops after launching its Phase II trial...

    Microcap pharmaceutical developer NovaBay (NBY +11.7%) pops after launching its Phase II trial of its NVC-422 for viral conjunctivitis. Roth Capital expects the results of the study to be positive, and says recent weakness in the shares have created a buying opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • NEM

    Gold adds to earlier gains, +2.7% at $1578.60 and bouncing off 10-month lows on technical buying...

    Gold adds to earlier gains, +2.7% at $1578.60 and bouncing off 10-month lows on technical buying and as shorts get squeezed. Big miners rally on heavy volume: NEM +6.1%, ABX +6.4%, GG +7.9%, KGC +7.5%, IAG +6.4%, AEM +6.1%, AUQ +10.8%. Smaller miners jump too: MUX +14.7%, BAA +13.7%, PVG +11.1%, AZK +10.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 5 Comments
  • CAA

    Housing stocks are having a bad day, with the Home Construction Index Fund (BATS:ITB) -3.1%,...

    Housing stocks are having a bad day, with the Home Construction Index Fund (BATS:ITB) -3.1%, Standard Pacific (SPF) -6.9%, KB Home (NYSE:KBH) -4%, PulteGroup (NYSE:PHM) -5.1%, Hovnanian (NYSE:HOV) -3.2% and Lennar (NYSE:LEN) -3.9%. Today's weak economic data (I, II) may be pulling the stocks down following yesterday's mixed housing-starts print.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • VSI

    Deutsche Bank says it's time to take some profits off the table in Vitamin Shoppe (VSI -3.9%),...

    Deutsche Bank says it's time to take some profits off the table in Vitamin Shoppe (VSI -3.9%), cutting the shares from Buy to Hold off the recent spike as they see limited near-term catalysts. The firm notes that VSI is trading at a premium multiple to competitor GNC Holdings (GNC -2.9%) and the growing disparity between the two is not justified.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • CTRP

    Shares of Ctrip.com (CTRP +4.4%) ride a pair of analyst upgrades higher. Brean Murray raises its...

    Shares of Ctrip.com (CTRP +4.4%) ride a pair of analyst upgrades higher. Brean Murray raises its rating up to Hold from Sell, while Raymond James takes CTRP to Market Perform from Underperform. Margins and China's economy remain in focus, but the overriding theme is that long-term growth potential still exists for the online travel site.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • KEX

    Shares of towing vessel and barge operator Kirby (KEX -8.1%) plunge after an SEC filing reveals...

    Shares of towing vessel and barge operator Kirby (KEX -8.1%) plunge after an SEC filing reveals downward guidance for FY2012, seeing EPS at the low end of its previous $3.85-$4.05 range vs. $4.01 consensus estimate.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) shares -10.3% after it confirms that the SEC has opened an investigation,...

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) shares -10.3% after it confirms that the SEC has opened an investigation, which could be connected to lawsuits accusing the company of misleading investors over prostate-cancer treatment Provenge.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • SUNEQ

    Up in AH trading yesterday after announcing its CFO is leaving, MEMC (WFR -18.8%) has now fallen...

    Up in AH trading yesterday after announcing its CFO is leaving, MEMC (WFR -18.8%) has now fallen to levels last seen in 2001. The struggling solar wafer/polysilicon vendor crashed last week after the poor guidance accompanying its Q1 report raised fresh concerns about its long-term survival.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • RGR

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (NYSE:RGR) trim 5.1% as the stock now stands down 27% for the month after...

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (NYSE:RGR) trim 5.1% as the stock now stands down 27% for the month after momentum was stopped in its tracks when the company announced it had to stop taking orders as it couldn't keep up with gun demand. Zacks' Brian Bolan sees the selloff as overdone, noting high demand isn't such a bad problem to have after all.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 4 Comments
  • DE

    Deere (DE -1.6%) slips after Citigroup cut its price target on the shares from $96 to $90 to...

    Deere (DE -1.6%) slips after Citigroup cut its price target on the shares from $96 to $90 to reflect a more conservative margin progression for agricultural companies given lower commodity values.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • IMO

    Imperial Oil (IMO -2.8%) is looking to sell its Dartmouth Refinery in Nova Scotia or find "other...

    Imperial Oil (IMO -2.8%) is looking to sell its Dartmouth Refinery in Nova Scotia or find "other alternatives,” according to CEO Bruce March. Several refineries in eastern North America facing closure on waning demand and mounting competition from newer refineries have enjoyed a reprieve as new owners find strategic fits for the mostly older plants.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • MAG

    MAG Silver (MVG +6%) shares shoot higher after the miner reports multiple silver/lead/zinc...

    MAG Silver (MVG +6%) shares shoot higher after the miner reports multiple silver/lead/zinc intercepts in its Mexican Bridge Zone property and plans to expand its Cinco de Mayo drill program. MVG increases its 2012 planned drilling by $2M to $5.5M, and ramps up drilling from one to four rigs with a fifth expected in the near future.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • VELTF

    Mobile ad firms Velti (VELT +14.7%) and Millennial Media (MM +8.2%) are bouncing after getting...

    Mobile ad firms Velti (VELT +14.7%) and Millennial Media (MM +8.2%) are bouncing after getting clobbered yesterday in the wake of the former's Q1 report, which featured some cash flow and receivables data that bothered the Street. Analysts defending Velti talked up the company's efforts to receive better payment terms, and its prediction it will see positive free cash flow by Q4. Update: Morgan Stanley has upgraded Millennial to Overweight on valuation grounds.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • INFN

    Shares of Infinera (INFN +4.5%) get a pop this morning after Jefferies ups it to Buy on...

    Shares of Infinera (INFN +4.5%) get a pop this morning after Jefferies ups it to Buy on valuation. The firm says the stock has been in the tank lately, and with its DTN-X generating early traction with customers, it thinks the risk/reward on the shares is very attractive. Furthermore, the stock now trades at 0.8x EV/2013 sales. This is the lowest multiple that the stock has ever traded for and near where it bottomed in early 2009.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • AAP

    Advanced Auto Parts (AAP -14.4%) sinks off of what on its face only looks like minor misses for...

    Advanced Auto Parts (AAP -14.4%) sinks off of what on its face only looks like minor misses for profit and revenues in Q1. The smoking gun could be supply costs that are running hot or a warning from the company that sales trends in Q2 remain challenging. Exec are live on an earnings call (webcast) explaining it all.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • GME

    GameStop (NYSE:GME) -8.1% following its miserable Q1 report and guidance. For Q2, the company...

    GameStop (NYSE:GME) -8.1% following its miserable Q1 report and guidance. For Q2, the company predicts EPS of $0.10-$0.18, well below consensus of $0.26, and same-store sales contraction of 5%-11% due to a weak game release slate.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -9.7%) plunges after disclosing it received adverse Japanese patent...

    Universal Display (PANL -9.7%) plunges after disclosing it received adverse Japanese patent rulings. The Japan Patent Office (JPO) recently invalidated the broadest claims of one PANL patent (while granting certain claims), and a local court affirmed an earlier JPO decision to invalidate the broadest claims of another patent. (Q1 report)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • GUKYF

    Gulf Keystone Petroleum (OTCQX:GUKYF +1.5%) obtains an injunction blocking Spencer Freeman from...

    Gulf Keystone Petroleum (OTCQX:GUKYF +1.5%) obtains an injunction blocking Spencer Freeman from writing about the company after his comments on message boards and Twitter caused its shares to fall. The posts about a deal with Exxon and a potential share sale were “fantasy” that damaged share prices, according to court documents.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 5 Comments
  • ACMP

    Deutsche Bank raises its rating on Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM +2.5%) to Buy from Hold...

    Deutsche Bank raises its rating on Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM +2.5%) to Buy from Hold after CHKM reassures investors on the issues swirling around its parent company (NYSE:CHK). Despite the rough patch, the firm believes CHKM operates quality assets that offer the potential for above-average distribution growth over the next several years.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 2 Comments

  • Bankia chairman Jose Ignacio Goirigolzarri hits the wires telling depositors they can remain...

    Bankia chairman Jose Ignacio Goirigolzarri hits the wires telling depositors they can remain "absolutely calm about the security of the savings they have in the bank," and calls the fall in deposits "seasonal." Bankia shares bounce, as does the IBEX, -1% after being down nearly 3% earlier. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • AAP
